intro: Psilantha, commonly known as the narrow-leafed psilantha, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. Psilantha species are known for their ability to thrive in well-drained soils and partial shade. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
